node.edge_media_to_caption.edges:
Let us bring you behind the scenes and show you what happens when we prepare our Beef Sukiyaki Short Plate Don! All our dons are freshly prepared upon order to ensure that every bowl has the same consistency and taste! 🤤🤤🤤

Step 1: We will place our short plate into our sukiyaki base to cook, whilst the chef prepares the soften onions on the pan!

Step 2: Once the sukiyaki beef is cooked to perfection we mix the onions together to create a mixture of sweet and soft textures and flavours. 

Step 3: We will first start with overlaying the rice with the beef and onions.

Step 4: Last but not least before serving, we will crack one Onsen egg over the bowl to give the bowl a creamy and silky texture to the don! We will drizzle the dons with our homemade sauce followed by garnishing with furikake and freshly chopped Green onions!

At Fúkudon, we take pride in providing a hearty and well prepared don while not losing out on quality and taste! Just like home cooked food, it will leave your tummies and hearts satisfied! Come down to any of our stores to try our Beef Sukiyaki Short Plate Don now! 🥳🥳🥳

node.edge_media_to_caption.edges:
🐯🧧 Let us usher in a Roarsome Lunar New Year this year with 2 special creations from Fúkudon! 
Our favourite local dishes with a twist, the Chilli Crab Salmon Don & Salted Egg Chicken Karaage! 🥳

🌶Chili Crab Salmon Don 🦀
A Singapore dish we all know and love, a mixture of our homemade rempah and our seafood stock. 
Not forgetting the balance between tomato ketchup and chilli sauce, this is definitely a classic flavour that you don’t want to miss! Did we mention that real crab meat is also used in this dish? 
Paired with a refreshing salad, giving it an extra crunch to the donburi!

🥚Salted Egg Chicken Karaage🍗

We use locally sourced Salted Egg to dress our home-made Chicken Karaage, paired with the creaminess of the milk and a hint of spice from the chilli padi, a match made in heaven! We are sure it will leave you craving for more after the first bite!

Available exclusively at our Punggol outlet only. 
Limited portions daily from 27th January (Thursday) onwards, so come on down to 660A Edgedale Plains to get it before it’s gone! 🔥

For pre-orders, you may contact us via Whatsapp at 87878755/ 96350148!📞

🧧Introducing to you our Roaring Combo this Lunar New Year! 🐯

The Roaring Combo consists of 1 Chili Crab Salmon Don & 1 Salted Egg Chicken Karaage for only $18!! 🦀🥚🍗🤤

2 popular dishes loved by all Singaporeans. A mouth-watering combination of sweet, sour from the homemade chili crab sauce and the creaminess from the salted egg chicken karaage. Every bite guarantees an explosion of deliciousness. 😋

If you would like it as an ala carte, our chili crab salmon don and salted egg chicken karaage are going for $13.50 & $6.50 respectively. 🤩

Available exclusively only at our Punggol outlet! 
Starting from the 27th Jan to the 13th Feb, with limited portions daily, come grab it while you can! 😉

📞For any pre-orders, please contact us at 87878755/ 96350148 via Whatsapp now!

In Celebration of Lunar New Year 2022, kindly take note of our closure dates during this period for both our outlets. 🐯

We will be taking a break during this festive period to recharge and serve you even better when we return! 🧧

Meanwhile, stay tuned for our upcoming special Lunar New Year menu! 😉

node.edge_media_to_caption.edges:
Take a look at our Shoyu Glazed Salmon Don, a signature in both our Marine Parade and Punggol outlets!

At fukudon, we only use Norwegian salmons, that are of the highest quality. Norwegian salmons have a distinct flavour as well as packed with nutrients! Our salmons are cooked in our seasoned flour before it is tossed into our shoyu sauce, where its cooked to perfection!

Our sauce is a mixture of mirin and shoyu (Japanese Soy Sauce), a perfect mix of Sweet and Savoury while exhibiting a hint of saltiness. Accompanied with an onsen egg and our in house tomato salad, incorporating a mixture of locally grown tomatoes, with Japanese cucumbers, onions and orange, topped off with roasted sesame dressing and furikake. A combination worth trying!

Come on down to any of our locations to give our Shoyu Glazed Salmon Don a try! We hope to see you guys soon!

To ensure that our Karaages still maintain its juicy inside and crunchy outside, all Chilli Karaages will be made upon order. So don't worry, we ensure that it is the good ol' karaage we are all familiar with! 🤤🤤🤤

A special blend of homemade Miso sauce. By using yellow miso from Japan, the soybean enhances and elevates the Salmon to a whole new different level. You will get to discover the depth of the soybean paste with the perfectly cooked salmon. 

The richness of the miso paste is balanced with our accompanying sides, the sweet caramelised onion, and our homemade pickled cucumber!

So come on down and give this special creation a try, a unique dish curated by our chefs in Fúkudon! 
Exclusively available at our Marine Parade location!

“During my secondary school days, my friends and I would Q up during recess to buy our favorite Donburi bowls. We squeezed a load of Mayonnaise on top of our meals, making it even more sinful and scrumptious. I had always yearned to create my own version of Donburi bowls with that same warm and hearty feel. Being able to bring my memories to life through Fúkudon is not only nostalgic but a great joy knowing everyone else can feel the same.” Chef Remus 

#Fukudonsg
#DonburiBowls 
#Foodie 
#Hawkerculture
#Singaporefood

The Santoku Knives used by Chef Remus since the beginning of his career were gifted by his lovely wife! He uses it to fillet fishes, butcher meats, and chop vegetables as its sharp steel blade gives a smooth cut each time. Chef Remus finds that the Santoku knives are perfect for chopping as their handles are designed for comfortable wrist action for tougher ingredients. Fúkudon is a hawker stall that values how our food tastes but also how it feels! We take pride in doing so through our dedication to sharpen our Santoku Knives for 1 hour each time, alongside the oil and care so that our tools can deliver the best bites to your table!

#Fukudonsg
#Santoku
#Foodies
#Hawkerculture

Mirin in the ring, throwing in that Unami punch! 

The Ingredient Series features the products we choose to emphasize meanings to its benefits, sourcing and flavor components behind them. 

Mirin is the 1/3 of our special blend sauce that is a cooking rice wine adding mild sweetness, shine, and fragrant aroma to our dishes! We specifically use Hon Mirin, the real stuff that is fermented glutinous rice with Shochu a distilled alcohol, and cultured with koji. The result makes it sweet without added sugar or corn syrup. Hon Mirin is such an ingredient that speaks for itself through the harmony of flavors creating an Unami sensation that every one of our customers should enjoy! Look out for that richness and subtle tang making it a shiok Fúkudon bite each time. 

#Fukudonsg 
#HonMirin 
#Foodies 
#Hawkerculture

node.edge_media_to_caption.edges:
This week we highlight your grandma’s classic- Soy Sauce!

The Ingredient Series features the products we choose to emphasize meanings to its benefits, sourcing and flavour components behind them. Yes, we are a passionate bunch on every single detail. 

Our special blend comprises of Mirin, Soy Sauce and Sake. Sounds simple, though, getting the right ratio down and cooking reduction levels plays a major role on how our sauciness enhances how our dishes blend together. Soy sauce gives a dark rich salty bean flavour that compliments the mirin and sake to harmonise depth in our dishes. We specifically chose @yamasausa as it isn’t too salty allowing the flavourful beans to speak for itself. A very straight forward taste that imparts umami that accentuates the natural flavours of our selected meats. Some say soy sauce also has antioxidants that help reduce inflammation and improves overall digestion! 

#Fukudonsg 
#Soysauce 
#Foodies 
#Hawkerculture

node.edge_media_to_caption.edges:
CHICKEN BREAST OYAKODON [$5.80]

If I were to ask you: Chicken Thigh or Chicken Breast, which would you choose? Many of us would definitely choose Thigh because they are fattier, making it juicier compared to other parts. Chicken Breast is often neglected because they are stereotyped as dry and flavourless. 

But fret not, here at Fúkudon, you will get a piece of the wholesome, tender and juicy chicken breast!  Served with soft onions, fluffy eggs and a special broth. The pan of delicious combination will then be laid gently on a bed of fluffy Japanese rice. It is definitely a comfort dish to have, any time of the day! 😌

node.edge_media_to_caption.edges: SUKIYAKI BEEF SHORT PLATE DON WITH ONSEN EGG [$6.90]\n\nYet another signature dish on our menu! Inspired by one of Chef Remus’s favourite dining experience - Hot Pot, he often sees people overcooking their meat that they missed out the best parts. Hence, he came up with a simple, healthy yet flavourful dish that will make you crave for more with every bite. Perfectly cooked beef slices paired with a soft onsen egg, its milky egg white and creamy egg yolk gives u a mouthgasm every bite you take. Garnished with spring onions and served with japanese pepper.

Pork Belly Katsu Don [$6.60]

A signature donburi on our menu! 
Thick, crispy and juicy slices of pork katsu simmered together with eggs and onions, a special sauce which is then gently laid over a bowl of steamed Japanese rice. 

With the right amount of fattiness from the meat and a bowl of hot and fluffy steamed rice, it is a simple, delicious and utterly comforting dish. Caters to both young and old. 😋 

Come down and grab yours now!

node.edge_media_to_caption.edges:
"(2/2)
Harmony 
Harmony defines as the quality of forming a pleasant and consistent whole. After elaborating on all 5 factors, it all boils down to this. Whether an ingredient works very well on its own but when put together in a bowl is the most challenging part of developing the menu. It is impossible to please everyone albeit Chef Remus believes that one can be always true to one’s cooking, which is exactly why he has chosen to take this path since young. 

“At the end of the day, as long as my customers put a smile on their faces, thanking me for the food I have served, I'm forever grateful for the opportunity to serve them. This is how I create Harmony in my food.” - Chef Remus

Let us share with you our bowl of happiness 😌♥️"}}]
node.location.name: Singapore

node.edge_media_to_caption.edges:
As we draw closer to the opening of Fúkudon, let us review with Chef Remus the last 2 factors evaluated in developing the menu for you: Flavour & Harmony. 

(1/2) Flavour 
Flavour is an incredibly complex topic. It has a unique way of touching our hearts. It could be from a particular experience or reminiscing smells of one’s childhood. Flavour brings about the warmth and memories. Therefore, Chef Remus always strive to find the balance to extract the most eventful flavour when you take a mouthful from our rice bowls @fukudonsg 🍚

node.edge_media_to_caption.edges:
This post focuses on two key factors in creating your food: Colour and Aroma.

As the common saying goes, “We eat with our eyes first”.
Colours of food always leave us a visual memory because they are the first thing we experience. Chef Remus diligently selects each colour component of the dish to ensure that they work harmoniously together to create a memorable impression.

The aroma reaches our noses before the food touches our mouths. Our sense of smell helps us to unravel the food before tasting it. Using his expertise and past knowledge, Chef Remus chooses only the freshest ingredients for his bowls at Fúkudon.

Stay tuned as we cover the last two key factors for Fúkudon’s menu in our next post: Harmony and Flavour.
node.location.name: Marine Parade Hawker Centre Blk 84

node.edge_media_to_caption.edges:
In our next few posts, we will be exploring how Chef Remus creates and develops his own recipes for the stall’s menu. The 5 key aspects studied during this process are Texture, Color, Flavour, Smell and Harmony.

To begin, let’s talk about Texture. 

Texture plays a big role when you take your first bite into our food. You will feel complementary components of texture like crunchy, soft, hard, smooth, chewy, etc. Thus, the texture factor is being well-considered while crafting the dons and side dishes.

Follow us now to uncover the other four essential factors involved in crafting our bowls for you. :)
node.location.name: Marine Parade Central Food Centre

node.edge_media_to_caption.edges: Inspired by the quote “Home is where the heart is”. Our Chef-Owner, @remussyl yearned to create hearty meals that will make people happy, blessed and feel at home. \n\nAre you excited to experience these meticulously curated bowls by Chef Remus? ☺️
node.location.name: Marine Parade Hawker Centre Blk 84

node.edge_media_to_caption.edges:
FÚKUDON  一口田

The right half of "福" (fú) (meaning blessedness) consist of 3 characters: “一口田" (yī kǒu tián), which literally means 'one mouth [and] paddy field.' 
With a rice paddy field to provide, one is happy and blessed. 

A brand new asian fusion donburi specialist coming to the East of Singapore by End Oct 2020

Logo designed by @canlaken
